A little bit about me

Here is a brief history of me, what I do and why I could be your best friend.


  • I live and work in Leeds with my wife Emma, our two superstar kids, and our little dog Ralph. I’m a fan of football, craft beers, running (sometimes/never), grower of veg, retro game player, terrible jokes, serial cake testing, and listening to a lot of music and podcasts.

    With over 15 years of experience being a curious designer in public and private sectors, agency and contracting roles for clients of all sizes, specialising in leading and facilitating design, designing clean interfaces, as well as plotting services and products from discovery to launch.

  • I do all of this by telling memorable stories to describe the work I am on - using strategy, research, visual design, and user-centered design approach to complex design problems.
    I'm passionate about all of my work, giving my 100% in each project, totally committing to delivering a solution of a high standard.

Notible projects

NHS - Reverification

The Reverification service aims to support the overall demographics programme by encouraging citizens to update their own demographic data, therefore improving the quality of demographic data.

Led the design initiative and direction to ensure the project ran from Discovery and Alpha smoothly. Managed a full design team, delivering a user centred approach within a tough development phase, using Discovery to understand user needs and Alpha to iteratively prototype and explore technical options.

DWP - Design system

Working as the lead designer, I helped establish the process and ways of working within a team that was, in previous months very delivery-led.
I kickstarted a community and contribution based way of sharing work, how to incorporate and use DWP's patterns within our prototypes and how to provide the design system with the right type of feedback to put patterns in the design system.
My role also included prototyping, presenting to stakeholders and working alongside MOD, MOJ, GDS, NHS, and DEFRA to ensure consistency amongst all design systems was met.

Universal Credits - Covid response team(s)

Leading "pop-up" teams to delivery design outputs quickly and accurately to cater for the influx of applications for Universal Credits. We managed to support 1+ million applications and lower the impact on the call center.
Outputs were html prototypes, supporting user research (remote testing) and presenting to ministers to showcase the goals.

Universal Credits - Move to Universal Credits

(Presentation available upon request)

Discovery based project, where the aim was to support users upon being moved to Universal Credits by 2024. Work included leading workshops around ideation sessions, meeting and presenting back to stakeholders and ministers and delivering a presentation to an internal board to ensure budget and the project was ethical.

Sky Sports - Super 6 rebranding and updating

Sky Sports - Fantasy Football rebranding and updating

DWP - Report Benefit Fraud

What I’m known for

  • Helped instigate and designed the first Design System for Department for Work and Pensions, ensuring we provide a consistent output for the end-users whilst allowing teams to control the process but make situational decisions
  • Successfully help lead design and deliver a politically charged service go-live. Presented the service design to multiple stakeholders, whilst joining teams from multiple sites and disciplines to help deliver a challenging service
  • Established new ways of working within Sky Bet, implemented ways to improve working relationships to help develop industry-leading web apps
  • Led the design for two iOS apps that were featured by Apple
  • Advisor for a start-up Emble on design and product direction
  • Design director on Bobbin and Bumble

Also known for

Running a mentoring program called Lets Learn Things - supporting designers and developers for career guidance and progression. Often covering subjects such as taking on more responsibility, leading as an introvert, building trust within your team, giving and receiving feedback and finally designing!

Nice words said about my work

The product was unquestionably better as was the team

"Michael has amazing ability as a lead user experience designer. The product was unquestionably better for his collaborative approach and for him always challenging the team to better meet user needs. I whole-heartedly recommend him to any organisation that values user-centred and results driven design."

– Tom Simcox, Content Designer at The Department for Work and Pensions (GOV.UK)

Added incredible value and experience

"Michael came in to help with our new season launch as we had 3 sites launching within a few months of each other. Michael was fantastic; he was very professional, organised and experienced. The sites have certainly moved forward"

Always generous with his time, talent, and humor.
